Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.client

Interface HTTPRequest

  • public interface HTTPRequest
    Represents an HTTP request to be sent by an HTTP client.

    Instances are obtained from an HTTPClientSession via factory methods like HTTPClientSession#get(String), HTTPClientSession#post(String), etc. The request is configured by calling setter methods, then sent via send(HTTPResponseHandler) or startRequestBody(HTTPResponseHandler).

    Simple Request (No Body)

     HTTPRequest request = session.get("/api/users");
 request.header("Accept", "application/json");
 request.send(new DefaultHTTPResponseHandler() {
     @Override
     public void ok(HTTPResponse response) {
         // Handle success
     }
 });

    Request with Body

     HTTPRequest request = session.post("/api/users");
 request.header("Content-Type", "application/json");
 request.startRequestBody(handler);
 request.requestBodyContent(ByteBuffer.wrap(jsonData));
 request.endRequestBody();

    Streaming Upload with Backpressure

     request.startRequestBody(handler);
 while (hasMoreData()) {
     ByteBuffer chunk = getNextChunk();
     int consumed = request.requestBodyContent(chunk);
     if (consumed < chunk.remaining()) {
         // Buffer not fully consumed, retry later
         scheduleRetry(chunk);
         break;
     }
 }
 request.endRequestBody();

    HTTP/2 Priority (Optional)

     HTTPRequest request = session.get("/style.css");
 request.setPriority(200);  // Higher priority (1-256)
 request.setDependency(htmlRequest);  // Depends on HTML request
 request.send(handler);
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    HTTPClientSession, HTTPResponseHandler

      Cancels the request.

      Sets a dependency on another request for HTTP/2 stream prioritization.

      Signals the end of the request body.

    • Method Detail

      • header

        void header​(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String value)
        Sets a request header.

        Can be called multiple times for multi-value headers. Header names are case-insensitive per HTTP specification.

        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        value - the header value

      • priority

        void priority​(int weight)
        Sets the stream priority weight for HTTP/2.

        Higher weights indicate higher priority. The server may use this to allocate bandwidth between concurrent streams. This has no effect for HTTP/1.x connections.

        Parameters:
        weight - the priority weight (1-256, default 16)

      • dependency

        void dependency​(HTTPRequest parent)
        Sets a dependency on another request for HTTP/2 stream prioritization.

        The server should try to complete the parent request before this one. This has no effect for HTTP/1.x connections.

        Parameters:
        parent - the parent request this depends on

      • exclusive

        void exclusive​(boolean exclusive)
        Sets the exclusive dependency flag for HTTP/2 stream prioritization.

        When true, this stream becomes the sole child of its parent, and all other children of the parent become children of this stream. This has no effect for HTTP/1.x connections.

        Parameters:
        exclusive - true for exclusive dependency

      • send

        void send​(HTTPResponseHandler handler)
        Sends the request without a body.

        Use this for GET, HEAD, DELETE, and other methods that don't have a request body. The response will be delivered to the provided handler.

        This method must not be called if startRequestBody(HTTPResponseHandler) has already been called.

        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to receive response events

      • startRequestBody

        void startRequestBody​(HTTPResponseHandler handler)
        Begins sending a request with a body.

        After calling this method, use requestBodyContent(ByteBuffer) to send body data, then endRequestBody() to complete the request.

        This method must not be called if send(HTTPResponseHandler) has already been called.

        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to receive response events

      • requestBodyContent

        int requestBodyContent​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        Sends request body data.

        This method may be called multiple times to stream large bodies. The buffer's position and limit define the data to send.

        Backpressure: This method returns the number of bytes consumed from the buffer. If fewer bytes are consumed than available (i.e., return value < buffer.remaining()), the caller should wait and retry with the remaining data. This can occur when the send buffer is full.

        Parameters:
        data - the body data to send
        Returns:
        the number of bytes consumed from the buffer

      • endRequestBody

        void endRequestBody()
        Signals the end of the request body.

        This must be called after all body data has been sent via requestBodyContent(ByteBuffer). After calling this method, no more body data can be sent.

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Cancels the request.

        For HTTP/2, this sends an RST_STREAM frame. For HTTP/1.x, this may close the connection.

        The handler's HTTPResponseHandler.failed(Exception) method will be called with a CancellationException.
